SENT.plain: During the period of 3 years and 9 months (from September 1980 to May 1984), 44 patients with arteriosclerosis of the carotid arteries were seen at our hospital
In 10 of them, arterial reconstructive surgery was performed
Ages ranged from 50 to 75 years (mean, 61.9 years)
They had a total of 13 lesions in the carotid arteries, which were composed of one complete obstruction, 10 stenoses, one aneurysm, and one tortuosity
These lesions were treated by either thromboendarterectomy (TEA), TEA along with vein patch, vein patch, or aneurysmorrhaphy
Three of these 10 patients were subjected to the second operation because of remaining disease or recurrence of symptoms
